which includes general information and actions to take in the event of an emergency. The plan includes all required aspects of an Emergency Action Plan and was modified with the intent to best streamline the actions to take following an emergency. The plan identifies alerts and notifications, what to do in the event of an emergency, evacuation, extinguishers, operations, employee duties, and meeting points and accountability.

Franklin County LEPC is the Local Emergency Planning Committee covering this facility. The Pasco Fire Department are the primary first responders for this facility.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety
OXARC, Inc. has no plans at the present time.

RMP Program revision that prompted this RMP resubmission. The goal of each compliance audit should be to identify areas which may need correction or improvements. Each action item identified is given a timeline for completion. 

Incident Investigation.
OXARC, Inc. promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could result in an unintentional release of a regulated substance. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years. There have been no incidents associated with this facility.

Employee Participation.
OXARC, Inc. believes that safety management and accident prevention is a team effort. OXARC employees are included in decisions as they pertain to the covered processes and are encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our employees have access to all information created as part of this facility's implementation of the RMP rule, including information resulting from any hazard analyses. 

Contractors.
On occasion, OXARC, Inc. hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities. Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety of the contractor is carried out. OXARC has a strict policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards related to the contractors work and the processes. Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release occur.

Five-Year Accident History.
The facility has had zero RMP reportable incidents in the previous five years. All incidents will be evaluated against the RMP reportable incident definition and will be reported in the EPA’s CDX RMP*eSubmit system as necessary, within six months of the incident date.

Emergency Response Plan.
OXARC, Inc. has an Emergency Response Plan for the facility

t 68. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that is in place at this facility.

Process Safety Information.
OXARC, Inc. maintains safety information that describes the chemical hazards, handling, storage, and usage of the regulated substance at this facility. In addition, engineered drawings are available for reference and to help mitigate any operational or maintenance procedures. 

Process Hazard Analysis.
This facility conducts reviews to ensure that hazards associated with the handling, storage, and filling of cylinders are identified and controlled efficiently. Any findings related the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner. The most recent PHA review was preformed on 1/23/2023.

Operating Procedures.
For the purpose of safely handling, filling, and storing cylinders, OXARC, Inc. has written procedures that address the production of filling LPGs.

Training.
OXARC, Inc. has a comprehensive program in place to ensure employees who are responsible for the handling of hazardous substances are competent in the procedures. Refresher training is provided on an ongoing basis. Procedures provided via the Propane Education and Research Council with additional OTJ training provided.

Mechanical Integrity.
OXARC, Inc. takes great care in ensuring that the structural integrity of the containers and cylinders is maintained throughout the handling and storage of these containers, cylinders, and any equipment associated with the process. Each cylinder is inspected prior to filling and additional maintenance is performed as necessary.

Management of Change.
The most recent review/revision of procedures was performed on 2/24/2023. Employees whose job tasks are affected by a modification in the operating procedures are promptly made aware of and trained in these changes.

Compliance Audits.
Compliance audits are performed on an ongoing schedule (every three years) with the last one completed on 12/9/2023 prior to the PSM/

Executive Summary for 
OXARC, Inc.
1530 Dietrich Rd.
Pasco, WA 99301

Storage and Filling of Butane, Propane, Isobutane and mixtures of LPGs. 

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies.
We are OXARC, Inc. are strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety. This commitment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as receipt of containers and product, storage, and employee training associated with the chemicals at this facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances for the safety of our employees and the public. 

Under the Accidental Release Prevention Program, responsibility for the proper handling and storage of flammable gases stored and used at this facility is given to the production supervisor and overseen by the EHS Manager. Additionally, OXARC, Inc. senior management have responsibility to ensure facility managers, supervisors and the EHS Manager keep the program up-to-date and that all reports and findings are taken care of in a timely manner.

The Regulated Substances Handled/
The facility is typically minimally occupied and is used for filling LPG gases and other company activities. There are three substances stored at the facility above the regulatory threshold (butane, propane, and isobutane) as well as a single bulk storage tank of an LPG mix (70% butane, 30% propane). Each is filled at this facility out of the bulk storage tanks and into the cylinders which are then distributed to our wholesalers and retail facilities for sale. The most common size cylinders filled are 100 lbs. cylinders. The largest size cylinder filled are 510 lbs cylinders which are occasionally filled.

General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps.
This facility has taken all of the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Par
